text: Party keg @ Bambergs comes to skoven. Pours almost clear golden with a white head. Aroma of breadcrust and ceral, quite fruity, with a touch of citrus, quite grassy. Taste is quite bitter, with loads of bready malts, quite grassy. Clean and crisp :)

From party fass @ Bamberg comes to Skovhaven. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of cereal, bread, floral, citrus, seems super fresh! Taste is heavy cereal, bread, floral, citrus, grass, wauw! So balanced and clean, this is superb!
Draft at Ma Che, Rome. Steely grain and deep fruit. Smooth, full bodied, woody. Grapes, round, sweet, darker orange. Very tasty, full flavor. Lovely.

Dalla botte in birrificio.
Chiara con schiuma non troppo persistente.
Bella carbonara, miele, fieno, meno amara di altre.

Tap at the brewery. Dark, lacy head. Medium brown color. Light caramel nose, rich malts, bready. Toasty. Grainy, earthy falvor, rich malts. Peppery, earthy hops, dark chocolate. Fabulous and sueffig lager. Wish I had time for a few more.
On tap at the Brewpub. Leicht trübes orangegoldenes Bier mit einer ordentlichen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch leicht malzig, fruchtig, dezent gehopft. Geschmack fruchtig, malzig, mild gehopft, Karamell.
Bevuta al TheDrunkenDuck! Buonissima Lager dal colore oro, limpida e con schiuma densa e persistente. Al naso e al palato un trionfo di malto.
On tap buna schiuma discreta persistenzaben malta miele acacia amaro contenuta ma non stucchevule
Gravity pour at the keller. Aroma is earthy and tea leaves. Taste is earthy, some chewy malts and even mushrooms. Alcohol is more perceptible. Decent and simple. Drinks well.

From a gravity wood barrel at Macche in Rome, opened and poured directly by Manuele. This beer pours amber colour with a nice and consistent white foam. The aroma are thin bready malts and a pleasant hoppiness. The beer stays dry in the mouth, balanced and with the consistence of bread. Nice lager!

Gravity barrel pour at a small festival outside the brewpub in August, 2014: Murky golden orange (glass-tested, considerably lighter than what the profile picture illustrates). Creamy and persistent white foam. Clean and bright aroma of dusty yeast, peach jam-filled cookies, new mown hay, herbal hops, lemon candy, and a hint of marmalade. Soft and fine carbonation. Dry, lean and toasty yet well textured with rich hay-dust pils malt. Sparkling hop notes supplement the very clean body with a lemon oil purity. Sweet, toasty and cookielike Munich is accentuated by a surge of lemony-herbal Spalt-derived sharpness. Excellent depth and fullness due to the exquisitely extracted malt, and the ensuing medley of vibrant apricot and orangey fruitiness is also welcomed. Malt is quite edgeless throughout, but gets nicely coarsened by a rustic tinge of sulfury yeast and scratchy minerals. Fresh-picked hop oil character teems with luster. Finishes well-attenuated yet succulently cookie- and toasted bread-like, with a sealing punch of coarse Spalt. A very soulful and cohesive kellerbier with that telltale Franconian charm.
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Bevuta direttamente dalla botte @whynot Alassio, ottima lager della franconia anche se non una delle mie preferite. La lager del vicino griess e superiore...

UPDATED: JUL 21, 2016 Tap @ Brewery, Geisfeld. From the wood. Pours amber with a creamy head and lacings. Very bready and grassy hoppy. Clean, dry and hoppy. Very tasty! Numerous drinking sessions over the years.. Amazing.

Gravity pour at the brewery. Aroma is really grainy, neutral, light earthy notes, nutty aromas, toasted malt - cleanest kellerbier yet, but not necessarily in a good way, lacks a bit of character, pretty neutral. Taste is grainy, herbal tea-like flavors. Light-medium body with medium carbonation. Easy drinking.
What a masterpiece! Im drinking this beer @macchesiete for the Frankenfest. Really nice beer. Fruity with an orange colour its easy to drink with a malt aftertaste. Very good!

18/03/2014 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Bevuta al FrankenFest. Dorata limpida, bel cappello di schiuma bianca abbondante e persistente. Al naso delicati sentori di malto, pane, discreta presenza di luppolo. In bocca malto, pane, cereali, luppolo nel finale. Corpo leggero, carbonazione media. Esile e facile da bere, equilibrata, fresca, buonissima!

(live at the Brauereigasthof) Hazy, golden colour with a blond medium-sized foamy head. Particularly grainy malty aroma with very present herbal hoppy notes. Well-rounded malt- and hops-character with grainy spots and a whiff of barnyard in he positive sense; dry and lasting herbal hoppy finish. Very pleasant. 26.I.14
On tap at the brewery in Geisfeld.  Its golden, cold and quite hoppy and very decent.  Pretty hoppy in fact, some toffee.  Good.

On tap at the brewery Gasthof, 19 July 2012. Amber coloured with a decent, off-white head. Aroma of tartish hedgerow fruit, a hint of chocolate powder and leafy hops. Flavour was malty, with more fruit, a touch of yeasty and flinty edge, leading to a soft finish. Very drinkable and a bargain at less than 2 euros.

My Bottom Line :  
Herbal, spicy hops surround bready malts and their subtle toastiness before taking this rustic lager into surprisingly bitter territories. 

Further Personal Perceptions :  
-A veil of foam tops the krug, which later reveals an amber-hued brew. 
-The aroma is not bold enough to match the poignant hop finish.
-Light caramelization is not necessarily harmonious with the hop signature. 
-An earthy touch appears in the beautifully hoppy finish.

On tap at the brewery gasthof.

Wenig herber Antrunk, absolut mild. Der Hopfen ist absolut verwässert, ersetzt sich zum Mittelteil ein. Wenig nussig, aufgrund der Wässrigkeit legit sich dies recht schnell. Wegen der vorherrschenden Milde eher langweilig, die Würzigkeit gibt zu wenig herb, obwohl die Grundtöne vielversprechend sind. Herb-wässriger Abgang. 8/7/8/8//8
Clear golden with a tiny white head. Malty aroma with hints of hops. Flavour had malt, grassy hops and straw. Finished somewhat dry and bitter.

Ceramic mug.  Airy head.  Orangey-brown colour.  Minerally, hoppy nose.  Hoppy and minerally but with more dark malt than comparably hoppy Franconian country beers.  Pretty refreshing and the caramelly, earthy dark malts add an element of warmth.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2010 Draught at the brewpub. cloudy amber colour. Small stable white head. The flavour is mildly malty. Has a very faint hint of caramalt. Medium bitterness. Hint of aromatic hops. Clean, but slightly boring. 5 3 5 3 13

Draught at the brewpub. Mild fruity aroma. Appearance remains to be disclosed. Mildly fruity aroma. Also fruity flavour. High bitterness. 7 3 7 3 15

Draft @ brewpub. Copper color beer with rocky beige head. Aroma is mellow Frankenbier with lots of bready malt. Palate is clean, dry, smooth and quaffable. Low carbo. Fruity entry in the flavors and an excellent brisk hoppy finish. Tastes much hoppier than it smells. Bright and earthy, bready and hoppy all at same time. Incredibly balanced and delicious. Goes down so easy!

UPDATED: NOV 19, 2015 Single hop Spalt tradition Lagerbier, the same wonderful hop strain featured in the Knoblach Unges.

June 2008: Gravity pour at the brewery in Geisfeld on the patio. Nose of  wort, caramel, toffee, grains.   Grassy, wet, green noble hop character, moderately bitter well-matched with sugar.  Bright and clean and honey-ish.

From gravity barrel at the town festival on August 15 2014.. Turbid honey orange body with a short white head.
Hop impression is more mandarin orange than grass. Juicy and sweet, malty and yeasty, a little bit too turbid and chalky in the mouth, but the brewers themselves are carting around the little firkins.

Draught @ Brauerei Krug Geisfeld, Strullendorf-Geisfeld, Oberfranken/Bayern, Germany. Clear light to medium amber color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, roasted, caramel, toffee. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a average duration. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. (210308)

Tap, at the brewpub July 2005. Amber bronze, thin white head and gentle condition. Pleasant sweet toffee and earthy hops in the nose, good mix of caramel and bitter hop in the mouth with some background chalkiness and a dry roasted finish with lingering hop bitterness.

On tap at the brewery: Dark amber coloured; thin foamy layer; quite full-bodied brew; malty taste, but not sweet at all; surprisingly bitter flavour and sharp bitter-hoppy finish; typical franconian "Landbier", nice and pleasant combination of a malty body with a distinctive bitter finish......
